titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for John W. Bigelow papers 1918-1919.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Len Coombs

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Len Coombs 2002-08
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

change.item: Converted to EAD2002 using Word macro and Xmetal
Original encoding in EAD ver. 1.0 from Word 6.0 file using word macros and manual tagging in A/E.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
John W. Bigelow papers, 1918-1919.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Soldier from Copemish, Mich., member of Co. E, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes correspondence, certificates of recognition, and obituary concerning work of the Polar Bear Expedition; and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Frank Mills, of Copemish, Michigan, in 1966 (Donor no.: 4414).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, John W. Bigelow papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of Copemish, Mich., served as private, Co. E, 339th Infantry. Bigelow died of pneumonia shortly after arriving in Russia.

scopecontent.p: The papers consist mainly of obituaries and miscellaneous clippings. Photographs include portraits of Bigelow.
